title: How Old Do You Need To Be To Watch The Game?
body: I've been wondering how old you must be to participate watching in a esports game since I'm quite young myself

replies.body:
Hey man, I'll do my best here ;)

Australian Law only implements a legally binding regulation on pornographic online content. However, the ACMA may [restrict access](http://www.classification.gov.au/Public/Resources/Pages/Parents.aspx#6) to online content upon valid complaint, or under their own initiative. But this is limited to Australian-hosted content.
> **So with all the legal jargon out of the way:**
> 
> + The OPL is not currently under any ACMA restrictions. That means anyone can watch it legally.
> 
> + There is also no age limit to watch the OPL live either.
> + LCS is also safe since it is not "Australian-hosted".

If you're particularly worried about about this, you might want to contact the [ACMA](http://www.acma.gov.au/) yourself and ask. After all I'm not a qualified lawyer, so it's very possible I might have missed something. Or alternatively you could also give the [Broadcasting Services Act](https://www.legislation.gov.au/Details/C2016C00519) a read.

I hope that helps!
